alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 8:22PM CDT until May 06 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .Water levels look to rise back into Minor Flood Stage tonight and drop back down to Action stage later this week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 66.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 69.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall to 68.0 feet and begin rising again early Monday morning. It will rise to 69.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
